greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Generalized Pascal Triangle - satisfying the same recurrence as Pascal's triangle, but with a(n,0)=1 and a(n,n)=10^n (instead of both being 1).
comment: Like with Pascal's triangle, the columns grown polynomially. For example, a(n,1)=10+n, a(n,2)=(1/2)*(180+19n+n^2), a(n,3)=(1/6)*(5400 + 569n + 30n^2 + n^3). Likewise, diagonals grow exponentially: a(n,n)=10^n, a(n,n-1) = (10^n-1) / 9. [_Kellen Myers_, Jan 24 2010]
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10152 (rows 0 to 141, flattened)
formula: G.f. of triangle: g(x,y) = (1-xy)/((1-10xy)(1-x-xy)). - _Robert Israel_, Jul 01 2016
maple: if k=n then 10^n elif k=0 then 1 else procname(n-1,k-1)+procname(n-1,k) fi
mathematica: f[r_, k_] := Sum[10^i*Binomial[r - i - 1, r - k - 1], {i, 0, k}]; TableForm[Table[f[n, k], {n, 0, 15}, {k, 0, n}]] (* _Alex Meiburg_, Aug 21 2010 *)
a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = Piecewise[{{0, k > n || k < 0}, {1, k == 0}, {10^n, k == n}}, a[n - 1, k - 1] + a[n - 1, k]]; TableForm[Table[a[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]] (* _Kellen Myers_, Jan 24 2010 *)
results.author: _Mark Dols_, Aug 28 2009
ext: Definition clarified, more terms, and revision of Meiburg's Mathematica code by _Kellen Myers_, Jan 24 2010
